Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen and published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Which genre does '1984' by George Orwell belong to?
Questions.Explanation: '1984' is a dystopian novel written by George Orwell, depicting a totalitarian society.

Questions.Question: Who is the protagonist in 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: Scout Finch is the young protagonist and narrator of 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Great Gatsby' by F. Scott Fitzgerald belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Great Gatsby' is a classic of American Literature, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Moby-Dick'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Moby-Dick' was written by Herman Melville and published in 1851.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Lord of the Rings' by J.R.R. Tolkien belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Lord of the Rings' is a fantasy epic written by J.R.R. Tolkien, set in the fictional world of Middle-earth.

Questions.Explanation: 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee and published in 1960.

Questions.Explanation: 'Pride and Prejudice' is a classic romance novel written by Jane Austen, published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'The Catcher in the Rye'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Catcher in the Rye' was written by J.D. Salinger and published in 1951.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'Frankenstein' by Mary Shelley belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'Frankenstein' is a Gothic novel written by Mary Shelley, exploring themes of creation and morality.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'The Hobbit'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Hobbit' was written by J.R.R. Tolkien and published in 1937.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Odyssey' by Homer belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Odyssey' is an epic poem attributed to Homer, recounting the adventures of Odysseus.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Jane Eyre' was written by Charlotte Bronte and published in 1847.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Chronicles of Narnia' by C.S. Lewis belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Chronicles of Narnia' is a fantasy series written by C.S. Lewis, set in the magical world of Narnia.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'The Picture of Dorian Gray'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Picture of Dorian Gray' was written by Oscar Wilde and published in 1890.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Hunger Games' by Suzanne Collins belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Hunger Games' is a dystopian novel written by Suzanne Collins, set in a post-apocalyptic society.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'The Scarlet Letter'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Scarlet Letter' was written by Nathaniel Hawthorne and published in 1850.

Questions.Question: Which genre does 'The Iliad' by Homer belong to?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Iliad' is an epic poem attributed to Homer, focusing on the Trojan War.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of 'Wuthering Heights'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Wuthering Heights' was written by Emily Bronte and published in 1847.

Questions.Explanation: 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' is an adventure novel written by Mark Twain, exploring themes of race and freedom.
